lead_paragraph: The Southeastern Conference fined Kentucky $50,000 for failing to prevent fans from rushing the field after the Wildcats’ triple-overtime victory against top-ranked Louisiana State on Saturday. It was the third violation, dating to last year, for Kentucky, which was fined $5,000 for the celebration after a victory last season against Georgia and $25,000 earlier this season after a victory against Louisville. Kentucky defeated L.S.U., 43-37, for its first victory against a top-ranked team since 1964.
